cluster_classes.class_description: Concepts and instances that constitute fairytale storytelling, including individual fairytale stories and their enduring narrative themes.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Fairytales have been a beloved form of storytelling... with their magical elements and timeless themes... these stories have become widely known and loved around the world.

members.entity_description: Enduring narrative themes in fairytales that remain relevant across eras and cultures.
Individual narrative instances of fairytales known and loved globally.

cluster_classes.class_description: Concepts related to the genre of fairytales, including the narrative form itself and its characteristic ethical themes.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Fairytales as a story genre with magical elements and the ethical teachings they convey.

members.entity_description: A traditional literary genre of fantastical stories featuring magic, archetypal characters, and moral lessons, transmitted through oral and written traditions and enjoyed across ages and cultures.
Ethical teachings or values conveyed through fairytale narratives.

cluster_classes.class_description: Recurring elements that characterize fairytales, including magical features, imaginary beings, and archetypal virtuous main characters.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: These tales often feature fantastical creatures, heroic protagonists, and magical elements that contribute to their sense of wonder.

members.entity_description: Supernatural or fantastical features commonly found in fairytales that contribute to their sense of wonder.
Brave or virtuous main characters featured in fairytales.
Imaginary, often magical beings that appear in fairytales.

cluster_classes.class_description: Abstract notions of uncertainty or the unknown within stories, legends, or cultural narratives, such as unclear origins of famous fairytales.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: the origins of these famous fairytales are often shrouded in mystery and folklore

members.entity_description: The unknown or unclear nature surrounding where famous fairytales came from.

args.justification: Assign a coherent class_group connecting this fairytale narrative-focused class with related fairytale genre, concept, and motif classes.
Link this fairytale genre and ethical-theme concept class into the same fairytale-focused class_group as the narrative and motif classes.
Assign the fairytale motif class to the shared fairytale class_group so its recurring magical and character elements are structurally tied to the genre and narrative classes.

args.new_description: Abstract notions of uncertainty or the unknown specifically within the context of fairytales, such as unclear origins of famous tales and their folkloric transmission.
args.justification: Clarify that this abstract mystery concept is scoped to fairytales and connect it to the same fairytale class_group as the other classes.

executed_decisions.justification: Assign a coherent class_group connecting this fairytale narrative-focused class with related fairytale genre, concept, and motif classes.
Link this fairytale genre and ethical-theme concept class into the same fairytale-focused class_group as the narrative and motif classes.
Assign the fairytale motif class to the shared fairytale class_group so its recurring magical and character elements are structurally tied to the genre and narrative classes.

executed_decisions.new_description: Abstract notions of uncertainty or the unknown specifically within the context of fairytales, such as unclear origins of famous tales and their folkloric transmission.
executed_decisions.justification: Clarify that this abstract mystery concept is scoped to fairytales and connect it to the same fairytale class_group as the other classes.
